name: LXC AutoScale
description: LXC AutoScale is a resource management daemon that automatically adjusts CPU and memory allocations for LXC containers on Proxmox hosts based on real-time usage metrics and predefined thresholds. It supports automatic horizontal scaling (cloning), container prioritization, energy efficiency mode, and push notifications.

notes.text: Security: Repository is pinned to release v1.0.0 (commit 5f4fc02) for integrity verification
LXCFS Configuration Required: Ensure /lib/systemd/system/lxcfs.service has the -l flag: ExecStart=/usr/bin/lxcfs /var/lib/lxcfs -l
After modifying lxcfs.service, run: systemctl daemon-reload && systemctl restart lxcfs
Edit configuration at /opt/lxc_autoscale/lxc_autoscale/lxc_autoscale.yaml before starting the service
